TopicTitle: "Rosetta" -- A KSP Short Film, and Its Explanations

Articles.Content:
I know this is a few days later than the actual landing, but hey, it's here afterall.

I spent a week recreating the mission and record it. I finished putting it together three days ago.

OK, this is the video you guys are looking for. If the embed thing doesn't work for you, click

.

If my video on YouTube happens to be blocked in your area, I'm sorry about that. But don't be sad, I've also got you covered.

So let me do some explanations regarding this mission. I recommend you to watch the video first, so at least you know what I'm talking about.

(If you don't see the embed album, click the link on the right) http://imgur.com/a/srtLN#0

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I am not going to post the pictures one by one, just because they're huge.

-- This is about Rosetta:

I have four KW's 1.25m tanks clipped inside the metal frame, to provide fuel to the engine. I also have a reaction wheel, some batteries, and some monoprops inside the frame. That's basically the body of the Rosetta probe. In tradeoff of the fuel, I don't have much space left inside the probe for Philae lander. It was hanged under the probe body.

I used an IR hinge to move Philae before separation, so that it wouldn't glitch or explode. In the "fold-up" state, it is actually partially clipped inside the Rosetta probe.

You might have noticed, I've got a KAS magnet underside Rosetta. It's used to stick the probe to the asteroid when Philae performs the landing.

Erm, that's all about the probe that I can think of, ask if you want to know more.

-- This is about Philae:

Yep, it is the three-legged little probe lander that made history. Even some failures occur in real life, it... ...still did a great thing. In my version, it does have solar panels that cover a half of the probe body, a grappling hook, and some science equipments. The real Philae has two sets of grappling hook, which I only have one; and the real one only have one cold-gas thruster. I used two RCS ports to resemble the thrusters, which will more or less help it move around. It does have a DMagic drill thingy as a part of science equips. The only thing that my version doesn't have at all is the screw on the landing legs.

It does have a small 0.625m monoprop tank clipped inside the probe core for the RCS.

Again, that's what I can say right now, just ask if you want to know more.

-- This is about the rocket:

It does have two SRBs, one liquid core stage. It does have a little bit too much Delta-V, from the separation of the core stage 1 to the end of orbital insertion burn, the second stage still have a bunch of fuel left. The last stage, the Solar Trajectory Injection Thruster (STIT), also have too much fuel, it can push the whole thing to escape velocity with 35% of fuel left.

There's isn't really much about the rocket, it's just... ...a rocket, pretty straight-forward.

-- This is about the comet, 67P/ Churyumov-Gerasimenko:

I used FASA Asteroids for that. Two reasons, first, it has some gravity, so the landing will be more realistic. And second, its size and shape are more controllable than stock asteroids. Yes, I once tried to edit the config file of stock asteroids, and turns out, their shapes and sizes are never controllable, it basically procedurally generated into random shapes. In addition, you can't stack them. They will blow up on the pad. I mean, literally, blow up, all over the place, sky-high, [just like this] . So I decided to not mess with them. The only bad thing about FASA Asteroids is their gravity won't work under any time warp. (Not physical warp)

Ast. 2687 "Ã…Â teins" and Ast. 21 "Lutetia" are from FASA Asteroids pack as well.

And, I admit that I did use Hyperedit to put them into solar orbit. Well, who would want to put a thousand-ton thing into a solar orbit which has a apoapsis beyond Jool's orbit?

-- And I'm gonna be really nice and give a list of mods I used:

Core Mods:

KW Rocketry

Near-Future Solar

D-Magic Orbital Science

FASA Asteroids

Procedural Fairings

KerbCam

Mechanical Jeb

Station Part Expansion

Hull-Camera VDS

Infernal Robotics

Kerbal Attachment System

Auxiliary Mods:

Trajectories

Active Texture Management

TweakScale

Tweakable Everything

Toolbar Plugin

TAC Fuel Balancer

Part Catalog

OK, I guess that's all.

Edited November 26, 2014 by Wavechaser
